div.p: One of the reasons I chose to go into lettings is because I’d done a lot of different things but not something solidly so I didn’t have
a degree or a qualification so this was a sector I could go into and be good at through hard work, I didn’t have to have any pre-qualifications
which I think was really nice about it. But once you’re in the industry there is a lot of kind of professional development so there’s
an association called ARLA that’s the association that regulates letting agents and they provide a qualification, firstly a basic qualification
which is a Level 3 entry and then they have an advanced qualification which is a Level 4 entry. And I think timeframe you’re probably looking at
maybe 6 months for a Level 3, part-time, and then 18 months for Level 4.
Because I work full-time I had to literally get up at 4 in the morning and study until 6 every day even on weekends to get it all done
so but it was worth it. I must add that I left it, my course was an 18 month period and I left it a year before I did anything so I had to compact
18 months worth of study into 6 months so that’s why it was those kind of hours.
